data.title: Allisyn Snyder
data.meta_description: Explore the filmography of Allisyn Snyder on Rotten Tomatoes! Discover ratings, reviews, and more. Click for details!
data.text: Allisyn Ashley Arm landed her big break when she was cast on the Disney series "Sonny with a Chance" (Disney, 2009-2011), but many fans knew her even better from her successful career on YouTube. Born in Glendale, California in 1996, Arm began showing a major interest in performing practically from birth. She signed with a talent agency at age four, and soon booked her first commercial jobs. Arm made her TV debut in 2002 on an episode of "Strong Medicine" (Lifetime, 2000-06), and quickly landed more guest starring roles on other shows like "Friends" (NBC, 1994-2004) and "Judging Amy" (CBS, 1999-2005). Arm also landed roles in feature films including the Michael Douglas dramedy "King of California" (2007), and explored voice acting on the animated series "Dive Olly Dive!" (Voom, 2005-06). After co-starring on "Sonny with a Chance" as Zora, Arm continued the role on the spin-off "So Random!" (Disney, 2011-12). She launched her YouTube channel in 2014 playing a character she wrote for herself called Astrid Clover. The character became a huge success, raising Arm's profile considerably. In 2018, she joined the cast of the comedy series "A.P. Bio" (NBC, 2018-) as shy but quirky high school student Heather.
